metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3592 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A symlink following vulnerability was found in Samba, where a user can create a symbolic link that will make 'smbd' escape the configured share path. This flaw allows a remote user with access to the exported part of the file system under a share via SMB1 unix extensions or NFS to create symlinks to files outside the 'smbd' configured share path and gain access to another restricted server's filesystem.

criterions.comment: samba: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
